doc.title: Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: FR-2: Core Data CRUD Authorized users (primarily Admins) must be able to Create, Read, Update, and Delete the core data entities: Business Processes, Risks, Controls, and Regulatory Frameworks. FR-5: Human-in-the-Loop (HITL) Validation: All AI-generated suggestions must be presented to a qualified user for explicit approval or rejection before they become active data in the system. FR-6: Role-Specific Dashboards: The application must present a tailored dashboard experience for each user role upon login. FR-9: Streamlined Control Assessment: The system must provide a simple, intuitive interface for a BPO to assess an assigned control.

doc.title: Decision Architecture Document
doc.snippet: Monorepo with frontend/ and backend/ directories. `frontend/app/(dashboard)/admin` for Epic 1, `backend/app/models`, `backend/migrations`, `backend/app/api/v1` for core entities. Implementation Patterns: API Structure with `/api/v1/` prefix and JWT authentication.

doc.title: Epic Breakdown
doc.snippet: Story 3.3: Build Human-in-the-Loop (HITL) Validation Interface. CO promotes a suggestion to the 'Pending Review' queue for the designated BPO. Story 4.3: Develop Streamlined Control Assessment Workflow for BPOs. BPO makes the final, accountable decision on new controls and risks, with 'Approve' (making it Active) or 'Discard' options, and 'Residual Risk' categorization.
